About this item

  • Universal Design - Our soundbar mounting bracket can hold a soundbar up to 15LBS/6.8KG. It fits most of SAMSUNG, SONY, VIZIO, BOSE, YAMAHA Sound Bars. Compatible with wall mounts (fixed, tilt, full-motion mount), TV VESA up to 600x400mm. (For Sonos Beam, please refer to soundbar mount MD5426)
  • Multi-Style Assembly - The detachable long extension plates are adjustable, allowing 180 degrees swivel for more mounting flexibility than fixed brackets sold on the market.
  • Easy Installation - Easily secures the soundbar above or below the TV. The teeth on the arms connection lock the soundbar firmly in place, avoiding leaving screw holes in the wall and making the installation a breeze.
  • Necessary Hardware Included - Come with decent instruction and necessary hardware. We provide the L-shaped bracket for soundbar with mounting holes in the bottom.
  • 100% Purchase Support - Our US-based customer support will answer your pre-purchase and installation questions every day.

    How customer reviews and ratings work

    Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

    To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

    Amazon Customer
    5 Stars
    Modified Install To Fit My Setup
    After researching the various sound bar mounting brackets available, I knew it didn't matter so much what bracket I selected because I would have to modify the install to make it work with my 32" TV's Full-Motion TV Wall Mount bracket (see pic’s). What I liked about this mounting bracket was the 180-degree swivel rotation that was very much needed for my installation to line up with the mounting holes on the sound bar and have it centered with the TV. The mounting bracket bars were too long to install per the instructions (bars in a vertical position) using the TV's bolt mounting holes. Doing so would have made my sound bar hang lower than I would have wanted it. I could have moved the sound bar up higher on the mounting bar, but I didn't want the extra mounting bar hanging below the sound bar or I could have just cut the excess bar off, I guess. Instead, I crisscrossed the mounting bars and used two bolt holes from the TV's full motion wall mount and installed one extra bolt in the middle of the bars crossing each other (see pics). Note: The bars appear (in some pic’s) that they extend about the TV, they Do Not. I also had to cut a notch in one of the bars to get around a nut/bolt that was in the way keeping the bar from lying flat and blocking two plug-in cable locations (see pic w/blue arrow). The sound bar I selected didn't mention it was designed to be mounted under the TV. The instructions only mention wall mounting. It took me a little trial and error to get the right height of the bars and centering the sound bar under the TV, but all said and done I was pleased with the results.TV Samsung 32”Sound Bar Bestisan 28” S6520HMounting Dream Soundbar Mount Bracket MD5420Sanus - Full-Motion TV Wall Mount

    The Mounting Dream Soundbar Mount also comes with detachable long extension plates, which was perfect for my TV setup. The plates allowed me to position the soundbar exactly where I wanted it, without any awkward gaps or angles. And let's be real, no one wants a crooked soundbar.

    But the best part? The Mounting Dream Soundbar Mount held my soundbar securely in place, even during my most intense movie nights. No more worrying about my precious soundbar falling off the wall and ruining the ambiance.

    4.0 out of 5 stars Handles my sound bar exactly as I wanted
    Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
    Verified Purchase
    These mounting brackets seem to be very well made and have a lot of bolts/bits included.
    I would say though, that it really requires 2 people to mount a sound bar the way you want.
    It's easy enough to attach the sound bar to the back of the TV, even with an adjustable wall mount already on the TV. But getting the brackets attached to the sound bar and then getting the sound bar exactly where you want it, is a much more intricate process. Having someone holding the sound bar up while you adjust the brackets and tighten would be substantially easier than doing it by yourself, which is what I did. It was possible, but took much longer than I thought it would. In my case I needed to use the key hole bolts for mounting an Yamaha sound bar, so the sound bar was not "permanently" attached to the bracket, which made it a little more difficult to place exactly where I wanted it.
    I am very pleased with the bracket though overall and how the sound bar looks mounted under my TV.
    It also seems to be holding position exactly where I put it, so far no sagging or changes in over a week in use.
